alarm.shorttitle: Process started
alarm.description: Process '{0}' recovered from a missing resource or failed configuration test. Starting the process.
alarm.resolution: No action required.

alarm.shorttitle: Restarting process
alarm.description: Process '{0}' stopped unexpectedly. Attempting to restart the process.
alarm.resolution: No action required.

alarm.shorttitle: Process failed
alarm.description: Process '{0}' stopped unexpectedly, and failed several restarts.
alarm.resolution: The system will keep trying to restart the process. Check logs for more details.

alarm.shorttitle: Login failed
alarm.description: Login attempt as '{0}' failed several times in a short period.
alarm.resolution: If condition recurs, may indicate an attempt to break in.

alarm.shorttitle: CPU threshold exceeded
alarm.description: The threshold for CPU load on {0} has been exceeded. The threshold is {1}%. The current value is {2}%.
alarm.resolution: If condition persists, check for runaway processes.

alarm.shorttitle: CPU threshold recovered
alarm.description: CPU load on {0} has recovered back to {2}%. The threshold is {1}%.
alarm.resolution: No action is required.

alarm.shorttitle: Disk usage threshold exceeded
alarm.description: The threshold for disk usage on {0} has been exceeded. The threshold is {1}%. The current value is {2}%.
alarm.resolution: If condition persists, clean out log and temporary directories. Remove old voice mails. Reduce log levels.

alarm.shorttitle: Disk usage threshold recovered
alarm.description: Disk usage on {0} has recovered back to {2}%. The threshold is {1}%.
alarm.resolution: No action is required.

alarm.shorttitle: Emergency number dialed
alarm.description: Emergency dial rule '{0} ({1})' was invoked by '{2}<{3}>' contact {4}
alarm.resolution: A user has dialed a number which is configured as an Emergency number. The user name and contact address of the phone is given.

alarm.shorttitle: Public address discovery failed
alarm.description: The STUN Server '{0}' is dysfunctional.
alarm.resolution: The STUN Server did not return any information that can be used to determine the public address of the internal SBC. Reconfigure your STUN server settings in the System > Servers > NAT page to point at a functioning STUN server.

alarm.shorttitle: The STUN Server recovered
alarm.description: The STUN Server '{0}' is functioning OK.
alarm.resolution: This message is informational. No action is needed.

alarm.shorttitle: The ITSP disallowed an Authentication attempt
alarm.description: The ITSP Account '{0}' disallowed an operation because of Authentication failure.
alarm.resolution: Check your ITSP Account domain and password and restart the SIP Trunking service.

alarm.shorttitle: The ITSP Account could not be reached
alarm.description: An attempt to signal the ITSP '{0}' timed out.
alarm.resolution: Check your ITSP Account Domain, Proxy and Registrar settings and restart the SIP Trunking service.

alarm.shorttitle: The ITSP Account has recovered
alarm.description: The ITSP Account '{0}' is OK.
alarm.resolution: The SIP Trunking Provider recovered and is now functional. No further action is needed.

alarm.shorttitle: The STUN Address cannot be resolved.
alarm.description: The STUN Server address '{0}' is not resolvable.
alarm.resolution: The STUN Server address is not resolvable. Reconfigure your STUN server settings to point at a functioning STUN server.

alarm.shorttitle: NAT Reboot or SIPX Public Address change detected.
alarm.description: The SIPX Server Public IP Address as determined by STUN has changed to {0}, or a NAT rebooted was detected.
alarm.resolution: Depending on how they were provisioned, some ITSP accounts may fail to function after this happens. If your public address changed, all ITSP accounts that were directly provisioned by your public IP Address will cease to function. Contact the ITSP to report your new public address in such cases and re-start the SIP Trunking service after the ITSP has reprovisioned such accounts with your new Public IP Address. If your ITSP implements "Hosted NAT compensation", and your NAT reboots, you may need to restart your SIP Trunking, depending upon the type of NAT you are using.

alarm.shorttitle: Stray packets were detected by the Media Relay service.
alarm.description: Stray packets originating from {0} were detected by the Media Relay Service.
alarm.resolution: Stray packets can adversely affect the performance of the Media Relay Service. Shut down the source of the problem.

alarm.shorttitle: The ITSP reported a server failure.
alarm.description: The ITSP '{0}' reported a server failure.
alarm.resolution: Contact your ITSP and report the failure.

alarm.shorttitle: An ITSP account could not be found.
alarm.description: An ITSP for the domain '{0}' could not be found.
alarm.resolution: Check your Trunking Gateway configuration and ITSP account. Make sure the Address of the Trunking Gateway matches the ITSP account server domain name.

alarm.shorttitle: Software Updates Available.
alarm.description: Software Updates Available:
alarm.resolution: Software Updates Available. Install the available software updates.

alarm.shorttitle: Could not send REGISTER to the ITSP account.
alarm.description: An ITSP '{0}' was not configured correctly. The SIP Trunking service could not Register with it.
alarm.resolution: Check your Domain, Proxy and Registrar settings for the ITSP account.

alarm.shorttitle: Failed to initialize the Media Relay.
alarm.description: SipXproxy tried initialize the Media Relay without success. As a result, the NAT Traversal feature will be disabled.
alarm.resolution: Verify that the 'Media Relay' service is running on the server. If not restart it. Restart the 'SIP Proxy' service.

alarm.shorttitle: SipXproxy lost contact with the Media Relay.
alarm.description: SipXproxy detected that the Media Relay it was connected to has gone away. SipXproxy is trying to re-establish the connection.
alarm.resolution: Verify that the 'Media Relay' service is running on the server.

alarm.shorttitle: SipXproxy detected a Media Relay reset but recovered.
alarm.description: SipXproxy detected that the Media Relay instance it was connected has reset and has successfully connected with the new Media Relay instance.
alarm.resolution: No action required.

alarm.shorttitle: SipXproxy detected a Media Relay reset and is trying to recover.
alarm.description: SipXproxy detected that the Media Relay instance it was connected has reset. SipXproxy is trying to re-establish the connection with the new Media Relay instance.
alarm.resolution: No action required.

alarm.shorttitle: SipXproxy re-established connection with the Media Relay.
alarm.description: SipXproxy has successfully reconnected with the Media Relay.
alarm.resolution: No action required.

alarm.shorttitle: Process failed configuration test
alarm.description: Process '{0}' failed its configuration test.
alarm.resolution: Check recent configuration changes. Do not hand-edit configuration files. Check logs for more details.

alarm.shorttitle: Process resource required
alarm.description: Process '{0}' is missing one or more required resources:
alarm.resolution: Wait for a few minutes to see if this is just a normal startup sequence. If problem persists, select the server and Send Profiles to refresh the configuration.

alarm.shorttitle: Process configuration file mismatch
alarm.description: The configuration data for process '{0}' ({1}) does not match the software version ({2}).
alarm.resolution: Wait for a few minutes to see if this is just a normal startup sequence. If problem persists, select the server and Send Profiles to refresh the configuration.

alarm.shorttitle: SipXproxy ran out of resources for NAT traversal.
alarm.description: SipXproxy could not allocate the Media Relay Session required for a call likely resulting in speech path issues.
alarm.resolution: Not enough RTP ports are allocated to the Media Relay. Increase the RTP port range allocated to the Media Relay using sipXconfig (under System->Servers->(click on server)->NAT->Show Advanced Settings).

alarm.shorttitle: An ITSP is missing required configuration parameters
alarm.description: One or more ITSP accounts is missing required configuration parameters.
alarm.resolution: Check your ITSP accounts. Those that require Registration must have a user name specified.

alarm.shorttitle: The certificate identity does not match the request domain
alarm.description: The configuration requires the identity '{0}', but the remote certificate contains only the following identities: {1}
alarm.resolution: This is a security violation because the remote identity encapsulated in the certificate does not match the address it came from. Ensure that the certificate identity matches the request domain.
